intro: Swertia caerulea, commonly known as blue swertia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and its stems are often hairy. Swertia caerulea is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional medicine.
